data.user_input: greeting: Hi; goal: Write a Python script to parse Apache access logs and output a JSON summary; requirements: Use only standard library and handle large files; platform: Linux; sample_data: 127.0.0.1 - - [10/Oct/2024:13:55:36 +0000] GET /index.html HTTP/1.1 200 1043; 127.0.0.1 - - [10/Oct/2024:13:56:02 +0000] POST /login HTTP/1.1 302 512; unrelated: Also, what is the weather in Paris today?

tone: I am frustrated because my code keeps failing; goal: Fix a Python function that parses dates; code: def parse_date(s): return datetime.strptime(s, '%Y/%m/%d'); error: ValueError: time data '2024-09-12' does not match format '%Y/%m/%d'; constraints: Please be kind and explain simply
goal: Explain the time complexity of this Python function; code: def unique(items): return len(set(items)); audience: I am new to coding; preference: Use simple words and define terms
